data.title: Hiller Instinct: Martha Coakley handles defeat in Governorâ€™s race - Boston News, Weather, Sports
data.meta_description: Martha Coakley wanted to make sure all the votes were counted before she officially conceded the election to Charlie Baker.Normally, the Democratic Party the dayRead More
data.text:
Martha Coakley wanted to make sure all the votes were counted before she officially conceded the election to Charlie Baker.

Normally, the Democratic Party the day after an election has what they call a unity event. And they bring all of their candidates, successful and unsuccessful together and the party celebrates its political efforts.

What there was this morning was a unity event for Martha Coakley. It was really important to her and to the Democratic Party to bring in Elizabeth Warren and Governor Deval Patrick, who planned to meet Wednesday afternoon with Governor-elect Charlie Baker.

This is a speech Martha Coakley could not have given this way last night.

She could not have given the thoughtful presentation she gave in which she moved to inspire women, called herself one of the winners, talked about the other people in the party, and her goals in the future.

She got, in her last look, a very good look.
